review.reviewText: Room was small and there is only parking for 1/3 of the rooms. The bathroom was tiny and dirty. The only plus was the location.

review.title: don't stay here
review.reviewText:
We were booked for 3 nights and checked out after 1 night. They charge your credit card $50 for breakage--as soon as I removed a towel from the rack it fell down. I hope I don't get charged. Could not dry yourself on the thinnest towels ever. No coffee at breakfast--the machine was broken--could get hot water.  The best thing was it did have parking--which is difficult to do in S.F
  We thought if we had a 'name brand' hotel it would be decent.  NOT
review.positiveRemarks: Parking
review.negativeRemarks:
Better towels, cleaner, coffee at breakfast; cheaper price considering what we got
Do not charge credit cards $50 IN CASE there is breakage.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Stayed for a quick overnight trip to see a concert in the City.
review.positiveRemarks: Microwave and mini fridge in the room, which is always a plus!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were very small and the only ice machine is on the third floor. The parking was extremely tight as well, I was expecting some door dings.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, not far from the Golden Gate bridge to get to Marin and Sausalito and just a short Uber ride to downtown. Safe Neighborhood.

review.title: Not the worst cheap hotel I've stayed at in SF
review.reviewText: We were in town for the Nike Women's Half Marathon and on a tight budget. I couldn't see spending $500 for a room so we stayed here. Carpet was nasty and my son found dirty underwear under the dresser. We had a handycap shower and the bathroom had a mold problem where shower water leaked out. Parking is tight and there aren't enough spaces for all rooms but there is ample public parking just around the corner so that wasn't a big deal. We spent less than 8 hours in the room and it was close to the race finish line so it worked for us. I'm not sure I'd stay a week there, but a weekend would be fine.

after checking in, we went to room to find beds not yet made and bathroom not yet cleaned, had to go to front desk who had to search for housekeeping to finish the room. sheets were never changed during a one week stay. had to go to front desk 5 out of 7 days to get towels, toilet paper and coffee replenished. bathroom walls were moldy above shower tiles
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: False advertising: Free parking not available
review.reviewText:
One of the reasons I booked this hotel is that it advertised free parking on site. Parking is a premium in san Francisco. We were planning to drive my husbands big truck so having a parking space available was a big plus. We came back from the wedding we attended in San Francisco late on Saturday night, dressed to the nines, and there was no parking available at our hotel. when we addressed with the clerk, we were advised that parking was not guaranteed, it was first come first served and we would have to go find parking elsewhere. Needless to say after tromping up and down the SF streets late at night in high heels looking for a safe spot to park where we would not be towed away does not rank on the top of my list of things to do in SF. 
sadly when I addressed this with the hotel management and their parent chain, I was completely ignored! I DONT RECOMMEND BOOKING AT THIS LOCATION AT ALL AS YOU CANNOT TRUST WHAT YOU ARE PROMISED. thx donna
review.positiveRemarks: location, in good repair for decent price
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel should not only deliver what it promises but should stand behind those promises when something goes wrong.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Limited parking space so need to park around the corner.  Good location not far from town.

review.title: Don't stay here!
review.reviewText: No one was at the front desk for us to check in for 30 minutes. Rooms stunk and everything was shabby.

review.title: Good bang for ur buck
review.reviewText: Good location, many restaurants and bars 1 block over..about 1 mile from the ocean and walking paths to the GoldenGate  Bridge

review.title: Not very far from attractions
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel is closeness to the attractions. The breakfast is terrible. We did not even have the butter for toast. The parking is extremely limited and poorly laid out. Wifi sucks. With the exception of morning staff the other reception personnel did not care about customer service.
Was disappointed because there was no hookers down the street

review.title: Good location and clean rooms.
review.reviewText: The breakfast situation was disappointing.  Very little milk in the cartoon and it was warm from sitting out.  No half and half for the coffee.  Very good location with surprising number of small restaurants near by.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast situation, parking spaces.
review.locationRemarks: Good small restaurants close by.

review.reviewText: The hotel is right on Lombard which is a very busy street. A lot big trucks drive by. Very noisy room. Wifi doesn't work either.
Was ideal for our night stay in San Francisco, except the automatic light above the sinks took a while to switch off after we went near them!

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: We came late at night, our room was not ready. Someone was already in the room they gave us. At midnight, it not funny to wakeup a stranger. Finally, they gave us another room that was kind of small to put a roller bed. The bathroom was full of mildew around the bath and on the ceiling. There was no soap. The staff did'nt try to accomodate us. Except for the location that is excellent, this hotel would not be my first choice fo my next trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The location
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, to much furniture for such a little space.
review.locationRemarks: From that hotel, you can do everithing by walking. We went to the marina, fisherman wharf and to Chinatown.

review.reviewText:
The room was very small.
There is not enough parking spaces for all guest.
The prices are too expensive.
Breakfast is below everything we saw in the US.

review.title: Short stay
review.reviewText: Just an overnight stay. Just enough offered for breakfast to say they have one. Day clerk very friendly and helpful. Plenty of eating places within walking distance. Tour bus stops close by.
review.positiveRemarks: Liked the location
review.negativeRemarks: Offer more for the continental breakfast and clean the room up.

review.title: Motel nightmare
review.reviewText: Place is dirty staff ripped us off terrible experience !!! Noisy

review.title: For value read cheap and below standard
review.reviewText: Firstly there are about 14 car parking spaces  - so you will be lucky to park (on street is possible but metered 9-6 or there is a multi-storey car park in Pierce Street beside the hotel with charges of $2 per hour from 9am -10pm and max 2hr parking). The room was very small with no hanging space, the door opened onto the 'desk' with a bang as room was small and although there for two nights only a minimal service was given following the first nights stay -  cups and coffee/tea supplies not replenished. The inclusive breakfast was the choice of two cereals, bread for toasting and a pre-wrapped pastry. Vending machine juice and coffee but no English Breakfast tea (Earl Grey and other selections). Due to room not being serviced for second night, went to reception where staff suggested I look through the cupboards used to store breakfast supplies - only to find the un-used bread from the morning, bagged ready for following day. So for second morning went to IHOP opposite !
review.positiveRemarks: No I would not and would never look to use this chain of hotels again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything that relates to serving a customer

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and updated. Good breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff and clean rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Availability of parking, a bit pricy
review.locationRemarks: In San Francisco not far from the pier. Would take a taxi instead of driving

review.title: eh... What can we really say?
review.reviewText: Overall the experience wasn't a terrible one. It wasn't good either of course but if I had to pick one thing that really grinds my gears, it would be the fact that they do not have enough freaken parking spaces for their costumers! I had to park on the street for gosh sakes... No daily cleaning services, wifi sucked, walls are too thin and bathroom mold always freaks me out. Go and see for yourself and please tell me I'm wrong, cause I doubt you will. Thanks.

We checked into this hotel and as soon as we opened the door, we found someone else's clothing and shoes in the room.   We also noticed the pillows had no cases.   We went to call the front desk and there was no dial tone on the phone.   We went to the desk and the woman came and removed whoever's clothing and brought pillow cases for the pillows.   The phone worked once it was plugged in.   It was chilly so we went to turn on the heater and noticed that the plug was melted and the outlet had burned marks on it.   It did not work.   On the last day of our stay the television went out and was still not working the next day when we checked out.   The manager on duty told us everyone was out and that he called Comcast but no one came.   All in all, I probably would not stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: Mostly everything.

review.title: lack of parking was very stressful. room was clean
review.reviewText:
i wish the breakfast area was larger. the location was good. I would stay here again if i flew to San Francisco.
It would be nice if they set up a elevator. we had to carry our luggage up 2 flights of stairs.
review.positiveRemarks: the room was clean and i liked how th
review.negativeRemarks: install an elevator, make sure every room has a parking spot.
review.locationRemarks: there are lots of restaurants nearby and even a small movie theater

review.title: Hotel on the cheap-clean, free parking-no frills.
review.reviewText:
Nestled above busy Lombard St. this MOTEL with free parking isn't for the luxury minded.  The staff is very friendly and the hotel is a great location, but I hoped not to overlook Lombard, which I did.  Thank god for earplugs.

I had to change rooms because the bolt lock didn't lock on the original room I was assigned.  That didn't feel safe to me.

The bed was lumpy and the air conditioner didn't work very well...which wasn't horrible for April, but would be unbearable if you booked during a hot summer night (of which there are few in SF).

I kept wishing my expense account allowed for greater luxury and decided I would NOT stay there again.  I'm upping my expenses...
review.positiveRemarks: The location and free parking, although I returned late one evening and had to park on the street a block away...so spaces are limited.
review.negativeRemarks: They could upgrade their beds, pillows, and air conditioners.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great...there are many good restaurants in the Marina district and it's not far from Fillmore Street which has many fun restaurants.

review.reviewText: It was actually hot in SF and our initial room didn't have AC, they were kind enough to move us to a room that did.

review.title: Comfortable hotel in great location
review.reviewText: I mistakenly booked the same hotel off Falsom Street, big mistake. Stay at this location, safe, better quality of rooms, lots of restaurants close by, the Presidio and Fishermans Wharf also close, and is well served by local bus services.

review.title: Nice hotel in between everything.
review.reviewText: It's really nice and clean. Everyone who works there is friendly. They let you pick if you want a quite room or you don't mind. There is little parking so make sure to park in parking  around Conner in garage parking lot. I defeninetly recommend coming here. It's between Golden Gate Bridge and pier 39. Really like San Francisco and the fact people can walk every where.
Cable went out for the last 2 nights. Kind of sucked but overall decent stay.

review.title: Close to golden gate
review.reviewText: Broken AC and the bathroom smells so stinky. Never check in again.

review.title: nice hotel. ok staff. free parking fills up fast.
review.reviewText: Clean, nice hotel. However, I was disappointed to find out that the free parking garage was small and already filled up when we got there, so we had to pay for parking at another location.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean
review.negativeRemarks: Staff friendliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to the beach, the Golden Gate Bridge, and Ghirardelli chocolate factory. I recommend all of these.

review.title: Super nice staff!
review.reviewText: Not the prettiest hotel but very nice staff. Centrally located near specialty shops and national chain stores. Very accommodating to our needs. Clean rooms. Would highly recommend to anyone.

review.title: Quick trip
review.reviewText: We took a last minute quick trip to San Francisco. Not sure what to expect when getting to the hotel.  Staff was friendly and allowed us to park  at the hotel although it was not check in time yet. The check in process was easy.  We feel safe and walked the marina area at night.  We were not expecting a lot of accommodations so were very happy with the rooms as they looked nice and were clean.

review.title: A nightmare is better!
review.reviewText:
Old furniture, renovation done by covering with new paint. Bathroom not clean. Different size of rooms at same price. One standard size room with king bed and standard size bathroom, 2nd room, half a size.
Room to road side are too noisy. No noise insulating windows. Door clearance to floor up to an inch.
Breakfast room is too small and choice is poor. We went out for breakfast, even it was complementary!
review.positiveRemarks: The location. We have been a few month earlier 2 block away at opposite side, same price, far better place!
review.negativeRemarks: Complete renovation!
review.locationRemarks: Different good Restaurant and Breakfast caf√©!

review.title: Overall a good one
review.reviewText: The hotel is in excellent location-very close to the coast and the bridge and relatively close to Golden Park. There are good restaurants around. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the staff helpful. My main issue was the noise from the street early in the morning and late at night (nothing too much but still a bit annoying). The hotel seems a bit dodgy in the beginning since it is open to almost anyone to enter but I think the area is pretty safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Decoration, noise, entrance open to anyone.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great neighborhood...
review.reviewText: Nice area, a lot of bars nearby on Chesnut Street. Nothing overly fancy, but was clean and comfortable...all that I really asked for.

review.title: Good price hotel, nice location
review.reviewText: Brakefast was very good, room was Ok, just found residues of the previous guests the first night, other than that everithing Ok. Service was good and parking was aveilable every night.

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText: Close to most places. But room was dirty. Stains on sheets and bed and pillows. And bathroom was also dirrty in the bathtub areas.

Good location with limited parking available. Staff is nice and accommodating. I had one of the front rooms which faces the street. Yes it was noisy at times but it's San Francisco, not the country. I really liked the two corner windows- great for people watching.

review.title: America Best Value Lombard St. San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The sheets were very clean.  The room was tidy, rundown, but tidy.  Smelled clean and for the most part was just fine. But one set of hand towels had smudges on them--I was disappointed to find that.  The bathroom's wall paint was peeling around the edges of the shower.  Doors didn't have secondary locks on them just a deadbolt.  Heater didn't work (but room was warm enough).  Phone in the room seemed inoperable.  Check-in didn't go smoothly.  The clerk asked for a $50 deposit; wrote the deposit in on their internal documents but did not present a receipt.  When I asked for a receipt he said it wasn't necessary as it was recorded on the hotel's document.  The concept obviously went over his head to provide a receipt and why I would need it. 

The walls were paper thin.  On the third floor people arrived, with children in tow, until almost 2 am.  You could hear them--like a freight train arriving on the landing and loudly walking around.  

It looks like a family run hotel.  For the price tag of less than $100 it put me close to the Marina district so it worked for my purposes.  I didn't feel unsafe.  Just a lot of little things that need to be taken care of.
review.positiveRemarks: It looks like a family run hotel.  For the price tag of less than $100 it put me close to the Marina district  with self-contained parking.
review.negativeRemarks: They need a better policy for taking cash deposits (I requested a cash deposit rather than leaving it on my card) and ensuring customers their sleep.
review.locationRemarks: It is on Lombard Street which makes it easy for someone out of town to get onto a central street that allows you access to a lot of other areas.

review.title: Great Location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Location at reasonable rate.   However do not accept a room near the ice machine, the noise is too much to bare during the night
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: relocate ice machine away from sleeping area

review.reviewText:
clogged sinks, hair still in shower, toilet didnt flush good and parking was terrible. 

Staff was nice and hotel was next to a lil shopping.

review.title: Perfectly adequate and reasonably priced
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to bus stops and the Big Bus tourist bus stop was only about 100 metres away - great for getting to know the city. Located in the Marina District which is safe to walk at nights and has excellent retail and food within easy walking distance. Rooms are not large but was clean and comfortable with modern bathroom. No laundry facilities but the nearest laundromat is literally around the corner. 24/7 front desk service is convenient for assistance. Appreciated the light breakfast included in the room rate.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, right on Lombard and public transport readily available. Many cafes and great restaurants and shops within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: A kettle for boiling water in the rooms would be good for making cups of tea, as there were only coffee making facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the Marina District, walk to shops and eateries of all types and price ranges. Long but pleasant walk to Palace of Fine Arts and the coast.

review.reviewText: it served its purpose as a 1 night stay. staff was helpful, clean for the most part, and I did sleep well.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: It was all we needed since we were never in our room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a bit of updating.

review.title: Great hotel! Horrible parking...
review.reviewText: It was great hotel for the price especially considering every hotel in san Fran makes u pay like 40 bucks for parking a day. This place doesn't charge for parking however they only have enough spots for a quarter of the people they have rooms for. If u cannot find parking on site u will be forced to park on the road with meters, the meters are reasonable but it is a hassle to wake up n put money in the meter when u wanted to just relax on a vacation u rarely get to have.

review.title: Good quality for reasonable price
review.reviewText: I didn't expect much since the price was kinda cheap but everything was more than I expected. :)

review.title: Problems with front desk
review.reviewText: The t.v. remote didn't work, I told the front desk twice about this. One staff member came to our room and checked the remote and said he would come back to fix the problem he never came back. Some towels were not replaced. I had to tell the front desk twice before they replaced towels.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was a bit small but clean
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk needs to be more attentive to customers
review.locationRemarks: Good location restaurant across the street, attractions near by such as the Palace of fine arts. fisherman's wharf etc.

review.reviewText: service is fair; otherwise, facility is clean and room is nice

review.title: Facility is good and close to shops & restaurants
review.reviewText: service is fair;  facility is good and room is spacious and clean.

review.title: Clean, nice area, very convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice, convenient and the staff were very accommodating. The only problem i had was that the WiFi kept dropping out.

review.title: Happy
review.reviewText: Stuff was great room was clean need a new curtain though and don't put towel if it has stain...a nice place to stay though

review.title: Fair for the money
review.reviewText: Parking space is limited. First night i was asked to park at public parking. Next day some arrangement was done and i felt ok.

review.title: Nice hotel amenities and staff. Good Location.
review.reviewText: we had a great time in San Francisco. The hotel is close to the Golden Gate Bridge which makes it perfect for those who like to run looking at a nice view. The bus stop is is right next door making the hotel conveniently located close to public transportation. Also the street behind it has plenty of restaurants and bars its perfect for nightlife.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, location, public transportation close.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was noisy
review.locationRemarks: There was a bus stop next door and plenty of restaurants in the area. The Marina district is a very nice neighborhood close to main attractions.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Enjoyed free breakfast, parking ( though limited ) close to Chestnut St. (dining, etc.) Clean room. Not cheap but competitive.

review.title: Cheap, but you get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
Our first night at the hotel was pretty good, except the heater unit didn't work well. But, when we returned to the room after a day out on our second day, the wall of tiles over the bathtub had collapsed. So, we were moved to a new room which was much smaller, and not the deluxe queen we had paid extra for. No apology from the staff, and the manager never contacted me as promised for a refund of the difference.

The new room was ok, but the cleaning staff never did a decent job the rest of the days we were there. They would take dirty towels but never leave clean ones, the bathroom was never actually cleaned, etc. The heating unit worked better in this room, which was great, as the fan helped with the very loud street noise.

Parking is difficult, the spaces are very small and hard to pull into. Overall, a good price for the area, and not horrible, but leaves a lot to be desired.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price
review.negativeRemarks: The room could be actually cleaned, staff could try harder to make things right when something happens
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants

review.title: You  get what you  need, near to many placed
review.reviewText: It was very near to many atractions, luke palce of arts, presidio, golden gate bridge, near to fisherman's wharf piers! Easy to move from one point to another using the public services !!!! Great place !!!

review.title: No frills but good for the price.
review.reviewText: Met basic needs. We had 2 rooms for 4 people, 7 nights. We loved the location, close to plenty of restaurants and shopping.  One of the hop-on-off tour bus stops was just 2 blocks away.  Free parking is very limited but we were able to get a spot when needed.  The complimentary breakfast is very basic - we opted to eat elsewhere for most mornings.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We had AC and TV problems in one of our rooms and the promptly moved us to a different room.  Based on the price and location, this was an overall good value for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and overall value. Complimentary parking was a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are old (but clean).  The TV and air-conditioner in one room did not work properly. The complimentary breakfast can be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants and boutique shops within walking distance.  One of the hop-on-off tour busses has a stop 2 blocks from the hotel.

review.title: not recommended
review.reviewText: I arrived around 7 pm and there was no parking. I understand since they only had limited space. It's not easy but it's possible to find parking spaces two, three blocks away. They put us in a room and said they would switch us to a different room the next day. I did not know what this meant until I got to the room. It was next to the garbage place... but I was so tired and was ok with it. Then things just got worse. The sink wasn't draining and they said they would fix it the next morning which they never did. I tried to take a shower but there was something wrong wight the bathroom door that it wouldn't close. The bathroom light went off so many times during the shower and I had to scream... The worst part was that there were hairs embedded on the towels. sigh. Other issues that I had to go through: slow internet that gets disconnected every 5 minutes, no night stand in the beginning, dirty bedsheets, crazy bathroom noise the entire time, someone working at the garbage room when I'm trying to sleep around 11 pm, and etc. Maybe it was just that specific room or the entire place. This place is not worth over hundred dollars. I travel frequently, and this place is the first to make me write a review because it was so bad.
review.positiveRemarks: good location, nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: everything in the room
review.locationRemarks: Take bus 30 to Fisherman's Wharf and from there you can get to Ghiradelli Square, Union Square, and Ferry Building.

review.title: san fransico trip
review.reviewText: WE HAD A GREAT VISIT, IT WAS CLOSE TO THE WHARF AND MANY PLACES TO EAT AND STORES. THE PLACE WAS VERY NICE AND THE ROOMS VERY CLEAN AND STAFF VERY HELPFULL  WE WOILD STAY AGAIN AND RECOMEND TO FRIENDS.  BUS STOP WAS A BLOCK AWAY TO THE WHARF AND INEXPENSIVE BUSES RUN OFTEN .
review.positiveRemarks: VERY CLEAN
review.negativeRemarks: BREAK FAST
review.locationRemarks: GOOD LOCATION MANT PLACES TO EAT

review.title: Decent hotel, fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We needed to find something fairly close to the Fisherman's Wharf area (for an Alcatraz swim), on fairly short notice.  After a few cycles of upping what we were willing to pay (San Francisco is an expensive place to visit), we settled on this hotel.  The cons:  the room was small, almost cramped - this a place to sleep and shower, and little else;  it is located right on Lombard St, and traffic noise is noticable all day and night (we are used to that, and weren't particularly bothered by it, but light sleepers beware); 'free' parking spaces are minimal - they don't hide this fact, but we forego using the car as much as possible (thus we walked, ALOT) so that we wouldn't have to try to find street parking upon returning to a full hotel lot;  it seemed pricey, but, I don't believe moreso than other comperable hotels in the same area (most of which were booked anyway).  The pros: the staff was very friendly; the room was clean and updated; the hotel is fairly close to Golden Gate Bridge, Presidio, Fisherman's Wharf, etc - IF you don't mind putting a little mileage on your shoes (we didn't mind, so it worked out fine);  we found many good restaurants in the immediate area (all within 6-8 blocks, most much closer).  Overall:  it was a positive enough experience that we wouldn't rule out staying there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Where it is located.  We enjoy walking, and there was plenty within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking.  Possibly do something to lessen traffic noise in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Presidio, Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate State Park, etc.  Lots of decent-to-good dining.

review.title: Nice motel close to bars & restaurants!
review.reviewText:
My friend and I were in town over Labor Day Weekend for the SF Zine Fest, so we really just needed somewhere clean and convenient to stay, and this was perfect for us! It was within 1-2 blocks (walking distance) of some really cute stores, bars, and restaurants, which we loved! (If you're in the mood for a great steak, try Izzy's Steakhouse right around the corner.)

The room itself was clean and comfortable, and it had coffee & tea, a mini fridge, microwave, and hairdryer.  We're very low maintenance travelers, so this was more than we really needed and much appreciated.

*One thing to note: We checked in around 8 pm on a Friday night and the small parking lot was completely full except for the handicapped spot.  It does say "free parking as available", so you might end up having to park on the street (be careful with the hours, though) or in a nearby public paid lot.  The desk clerk was very accommodating and allowed us to park in the handicapped spot, but just warned us that if anyone showed up with the placard, we'd have to move.  (There are less than 20 spots in the lot.)

Overall, I would definitely stay there again and/or recommend to friends for a nice, but not high end place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, convenient, and close in walking distance to stores, bars, and restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: There are plenty of bars & restaurants within a block or two.

review.title: Good location to where.I wanted to be in the city.
review.reviewText: Great location to walk around Prresidio. Marina and wharf locations.

review.title: Oh my god
review.reviewText: Room was literally in the back of the garage parking, very small, over $200

review.title: OK for the cost.
review.reviewText: Found the maid service not great. We would leave early in the morning and come back late afternoon to find they took the towels but didn't leave any and the rest of the room was undone. Rooms were a bit hot. Staff was friendly.

review.title: Central location.
review.reviewText: They say free parking but you may not get a spot. 2 bed in 2 rooms were good.  Older facility.

review.title: Decent room for decent price.
review.reviewText: The room was clean, the grounds were quiet, and the bed was satisfactory. Parking is free but is first come first serve. Centrally located to some great sights.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

We thank you for choosing America's Best Value inn as your preferred hotel to stay in. We appreciate your kind review and we hope you had a great trip.
Hope to see you back soon!

review.title: Comfortable hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel had all the basics.  A small breakfast was provided in the morning.  The night manager on duty answered any questions we had about the city.  Would stay here again.

review.title: Ok Hotel close to restaurants.
review.reviewText: This Hotel was alright for one overnight stay. We arrived and the hotel staff was very friendly and offered great advice. There were a lot of restaurants of all kind nearby. Close to public transportation. Free parking. My husband, 8 year old daughter, and I all slept comfortably on the king size bed. If you stay here you might request being on the top floor, we stayed on the 2nd floor and could hear our upstairs neighbors. Overall, great location and bed was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments and suggestions. We apologize for any discomfort we may have caused to your stay.Please note that our hotel is located in a flat area of Lombard that makes it easier for guests to walk to us. We also provide dressers in the roomsand a rack with coat hangers as you mention. We do apologize if we weren't able to provide you with more hangers. We will attend to this issues as soon as possible andwe hope you will give us another chance as we do pride ourselves in our hotel and customer service.

review.title: Would not stay in this hotel again
review.reviewText: The rooms were small and the carpets and furniture were both ingrained with stains and dirty. We had no wardrobe just a rack on the wall with 2 coat hangers and when we asked for more we were told they didn't have any. The towels were threadbare and a flannel disinticrated when we wet it. All in all the only thing going for this hotel was the free parking but even then it was on a 1st come 1st serve basis as there wasn't enough parking for the number of rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The location
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: It was in a good location within walking distance to Fishemans Warf but beware it is on Lombard street and very hilly

review.title: Decent stay
review.reviewText: Only here for a quick stay. Room was decent. Hotel staff were really kind. We arrived really late and they were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location but not a great hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location. We got free parking too but that is because we got there at 2pm and check in was at 3pm. Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance so you don't have to take your car. There was minimal contact with the staff. The person who checked us in got us all checked in within 5 minutes. We got a room next to the vending machines and ice maker. The walls are thin, we heard the ice maker and people coming up to the vending machines. The toilet is really loud too. The room was dated. It wasn't the best place but it wasn't the worst either. I might try a different hotel in the same area next time.
review.positiveRemarks: This room was bigger than what I expected. The bathroom was small and there wasn't a closet but a rack to hang your clothes. Free parking!
review.negativeRemarks: The room was dated. The person checking people could smile or show some sort of friendliness.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of places to eat or drink near by. Palace of Fine Arts is about a 10-15 minute walk away.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: It was overall good. I went for one night and it was $115 after tax and they hold $50 deposit which you get back the next day. However only thing that concerns me is the supposedly free "wifi and cable" which did not work. And very limited on parking. I guess you do get what you paid for. Not bad if your on a budget!! :)

review.title: Room was a dump...not at all like the photos!
review.reviewText: Room was a dump, says free parking and they have like 10 spots, not at all like the photos! Waste of money. Would never stay there again. Internet didn't work at all the last day and I needed it for work. Staff was very nice, the only redeeming positive. Worst hotel I've stayed at on Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Everything...rooms are horrible, bathrooms are horrible, rooms smell., no parking spaces at all

review.title: Average hotel, nothing fancy
review.reviewText: Older hotel, we did like that you could park for free. Parking was limited so we were lucky to get a site as others were Not as lucky. We were farther away from the main attractions but close to the bus stop which was very convenient and could bring you anywhere. If your expectations aren't high and you want a less expensive stay in San Francisco, you will be fine. Felt safe in the area and our day trip picked us up at the hotel which was nice.

review.title: Correct for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was super nice, hotel was noisy due to its location on Lombard street. Price was good but it is what it's worth. Free parking was a good thing. Free breakfast is not something you can consider since it's only fountain juice, coffee and buns. Overall, nice place for the price..
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff were really nice,  location is good and price was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness, carpet is really dirty and we had to clean the toilets since it didn't look that clean.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, go to Mel's dinner, great place for lunch especially if you like the 50's!

review.title: Relaxing and comfortable
review.reviewText: Hotel was Close to many restaurants and the person at the front desk was very nice helpful.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Good location, VERY NOISY, friendly front desk. We had to ask for enough towels and coffee but then we had plenty every day. TV was without volume for 4 days. It was so zoomed we couldn't read anything in margins. This was never addessed. We were delivered a leaky ice bucket after requesting it. They're was an error with our reservation, but it was successfully resolved. The rooms were arranged around and above the parking lot which acted as an echo chamber. I left the empty tissue box on the sink counter and it was replaced in the wall STILL EMPTY! That,s when I stopped leaving a tip for housekeeping. We left for 6 hours with the window open. When we returned we still had to wait a bit for them to clean the room.
I would never recommend this motel or ABVI. Our subsequent stay at a Knight,s Inn was very nice.
review.locationRemarks: Several good restaurants. A $20 cab ride to Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Walking Distance to Marina, Presidio, Union Street
review.reviewText: Pleasant, accomplished what we were looking for that evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity
review.negativeRemarks: Modernize a bit
review.locationRemarks: Marina, Ft Mason, Presidio, Union Street...

review.title: Good for a short stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a much nicer area of SF than many others. It is surrounded by a lot of great stores, and its a nice place to just walk around. Its about 25-30 minutes from the airport, so its a good place to stay. Continental Breakfast would only feed a cat, though. Its just oatmeal packets, coffee, and danishes.

review.title: Right in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Wasn't expecting much upon arrival, but the staff was cool enough to let us check in to our room 2 hours early no charge. The room was not as advertised in the photos, it was way better very comfortable and for the price I was blown away. The hotel is in a clean part of town lots of shops and restaurants around the block. Its only a half hour walk from the Wharf and maybe 5-10min from the bay with a great view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate.
review.positiveRemarks: Awesome for the price. Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Cruddy wifi if you need internet bring a mobile hotspot.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, golden gate, old fort mason,

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: My family was very pleased with this hotel. Other than it being a little tight to move around it was exactly what we needed for the price. We were just in the hotel to sleep and shower. This neighborhood is busy with late goers but I was able to sleep through noise. 10 minute drive from piers lots of food location with-in walking distance. Not a lot of parking spots but I was able to park almost every night there.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Value for money stay in SF
review.reviewText: Lovely staff at check in and out. Complimentary breakfast is handy. Free wifi although very unstable connection. Free parking-- but very limited spaces-- but it's San Francisco! Would definitely come and stay again!
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi to be more stable
review.locationRemarks: Walgreen and bus stop (route 30, very easy to go to Fishermans wharf)

review.title: nice hotel and very good ubication in San Francisc
review.reviewText: good ubication and very nice hotel, clean and good service
review.positiveRemarks: ubication

review.title: Inexpensive hotel for the city
review.reviewText: The room was acceptable for 100 dollars a night I'm San Fran. The room looked as though it had not been vacuumed in days. I was able to park for free and not pay for parking. However, it is not as close to pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf as it seemed. The walk was about 1.5, by the time we got to the pier we were exhausted. I would have preferred to spend the little extra to stay at Pier 39. But for what you pay for it is very reasonable.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Parking- if lot is full check to see if the employees are parked there. I was told they have to move their cars for guest.
review.negativeRemarks: Vacuum! The room was so dusty and crumbs all over chair and floor.

review.title: Great hotel close to Palace of Fine Arts
review.reviewText: Great location for restaurants. Staff was great and had some great suggestions.

review.title: Excellent value for money in SF
review.reviewText: I was looking for a place to stay for 5 days, because I had business meetings on Fisherman's Wharf. Expedia indicated to me the regular offers around FW, but also suggested this hotel which offered a rebate for staying 5 days. I took the offer and did not expect too much, but I was pleasantly surprised with the comfort of the room. It even had a functional individual sauna in the room! I asked for a room away from the street, which is quite busy, and I had all the calm needed. The only problem encountered is that the WiFi worked very slowly during one day, but it was because they were upgrading their system and obviously, there were little bugs to be fixed during that initial period. Overall, very pleasant and excellent value for money in a city that tends to be expensive in many ways for the tourist. And I did my healthy 30 minutes walk to Fisherman's Walk, which is good before and after sitting down for the good part of the day...
review.positiveRemarks: Adequate comfort. Good value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi, but they are working on it...
review.locationRemarks: On Lombard Street, one block from Chestnut Street, a lively street for shopping and nightlife in the Marina. Pacific Heights up the hill.

review.title: Okay hotel and easy to get around
review.reviewText: I stayed here with one of my For a week and we were able to get around easily and room was nice for the price. Only thing was the bathroom was a little dirty. Would stay there again for sure though.

review.title: Cute and Friendly
review.reviewText: Near shops, restaurants, bars. Hotel Staff is Friendly. Room is clean good deal for a safe neighborhood in the Marina District of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Parking
review.locationRemarks: THere's a delish sandwich place around the corner and a fun Irish Pub for after hours.

review.title: Nice small hotel!
review.reviewText: Pretty, small hotel. Clean. Great location. Free parking. At night it could get full and had to park somewhere else, but there was parking available close by free as well.

review.title: Would stay again!!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location in San Francisco. Very reasonable price and if I am ever in the Bay area I would stay again.

review.title: OK hotel next to a busy road
review.reviewText:
Decent rooms for a decent price.
If you like walking it is in a good location to reach the famous sights and even the tourist bus stops close by.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable. We got a very good deal for a king room, it was close to the bus routes and easy to get around town. Small room but we didn't spend much time there anyway. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was clean! Thanks!

review.title: Inexpensive and noisy
review.reviewText: Very cool staff. The room was clean and comfortable. However, it was very noisy day and night. A good deal for the cost conscious especially when considering the free parking.

review.title: Good location, not clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed that this hotel was in walking distance to major attractions, including Fishermans Wharf and the Gilden Gate Bridge. However, the room was not clean and had plumbing issues. The drains in the sink and the tub were clogged. We would have to wait 15 minutes for the tub to drain before the next person could shower. There was black mold in the caulk around the tub. The hotel does not provide portable toiletries; only soap and lotion dispensers. The TV in our room was not functioning. There is limited parking; when we arrived there was no space to park our car and had to park it one block away in a public parking garage. The hotel staff member told us that this lot was free and convenient but we had to pay 25 cents per 5 minutes on the meter. Although the staff member said he would advise us when a parking spot became available, he never did and we had to park our car in the garage overnight. The free breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, oatmeal and toast. I will never stay at this hotel again and will not reccomend it to my friends.

review.title: Great Stay. Cheap Price.
review.reviewText: Overall my experience was great. The room was nice and clean. The free breakfast was delicious. The only thing that was an issue was parking not enough parking. However, I do recommend this hotel. Also, there is a lot to do in that area.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean and the free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: I would improve parking. Not enough parking
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect. In a good neighboorhood. The area has a lot of eating choice in walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel close to sights
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and were very helpful as I got there a day late. The room was average but clean. The bed was massive but very comfortable

review.title: Nice hotel, near muni bus lines
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to the things I had planned, close or on muni bus routes,
review.locationRemarks: Chestnut St is a restaurant row. 2 Walgreens is close for those forgotten items.

review.reviewText: Parking is bad, check in early. Noisy street but convenient location. Easy to take the bus to the waterfront. Good breakfast.
It was nice. We were barely in the room so it was great. The parking situation was not so good.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to most tourist spots.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great restaurants and bars. Not too long of drive to Golden Gate Bridge and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel to stay. Good to the price.
review.reviewText: It's very convenient to go to everywhere. Good staff. They are very patient. The room is clean and nice, although the heater is a litter noisy. It's very good to this price. I'll come again next time.

review.title: Happy Customer, will come back
review.reviewText: Being reasonably close to fisherman's wharf and other attractions makes this a nice place to stay if you are in sfo to see around places. Parking is limited. If you reach the hotel after 7, you will not find a parking. But ample public parking are available on the next street, and it is free from 10 pm - 9 am. Since we always reached the hotel after 10, we weren't much disappointed as we didn't had to pay the parking fees. For the price we paid (~$65) for a double queen bed with free breakfast, on the holiday weekend, we did not expect more. As the name says, this is a value inn.
review.positiveRemarks: Being close to the major attractions in SFO
review.negativeRemarks: Parking - If we come in late night and had not to worry about the parking, it will be good.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Crooked St, Marina, Academy of Sciences, Conservatory of Flowers - All are around 10-20 min by car

review.reviewText:
This motel is just for who wants to sleep and go out all the day
There is nothing in it

review.title: Good price, Nice accommodations
review.reviewText: Regular hotel in a nice and active neighborhood, close to many attractions. I stay in the hotel for 2 nights and booked a room with 2 double beds since it was 3 of us. I liked that the room was clean, bathroom was clean, had everything we needed, but it was a little small. I can't say it affected my stay, but for 3 people I would expect a bit larger room. Two things I would note though - breakfast was very limited, no fruits, cereal, eggs or milk; and the parking is first come first serve. First night parking was full and I had to park at the MTA spot in front of the building, but was called in the morning (8:30 am) to move my car since the hotel was expecting a truck. The overnight parking is free from 9 pm to 9 am in the nearby parking structure or street meters, but after 9 am meter per hour is about $4.75 (ridiculously high!). Next day I was able to find a spot in the hotel's parking just because it was still early in the afternoon. It was full again later in the evening. Overall, it was manageable and I liked the room for the price I paid, but I can see that parking can be an issue.
review.positiveRemarks: location, clean bathroom and room, room had everything we needed, even microwave.
review.negativeRemarks: parking situation and breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: trendy area with lots of bars, restaurants and shops. Close to Golden Gate bridge, Piers, Chinatown and etc.

review.title: Was a place to sleep
review.reviewText: This hotel was just a place to sleep. Wasn't anything special. Way over priced. We picked it because it was a little over a mile to some of the places we wanted to walk to but after seei fb the location there were plenty of other hotels closer that were cheaper and probably comparable or atleast cleaner. The tub was dirty and there were pubic hairs in it. The bathroom just didn't look clean. I stayed here with some friends and my son and mine of us would return.

review.title: Three nights in SF
review.reviewText:
We were traveling in SF for three days (at the end of November), and this hotel fulfilled our needs, as it's location is very convenient, most of the places of interest are at hands reach.
Hotel itself is nice, breakfast choice is same as in most of the hotels of such type, and I would say even better, they had cereals, toasts, buns and etc.
Parking lot is small, but it's SF. However we have always found an open spot.
In general if you are looking for a place just to crash in, it's perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good location, price to quality ratio.
review.locationRemarks: Things to do near depends on person. The hotel has free wi-fi, so you can yelp, google, trip advisor things to do :)

review.title: All in all pleasant.
review.reviewText: good
review.positiveRemarks: clean
review.negativeRemarks: carpet stain and lamp switch broken
review.locationRemarks: good location, practical closeness of restaurants etc.

review.title: Short Stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. My friends and I all agreed that it was a great pick. We were also pleasantly surprised by a continental breakfast the morning we left. The parking was easy, staff was great, location was great. We had 0 complaints. I would highly recommend this hotel. Oh, and price was good too!!
review.positiveRemarks: clean, friendly staff, good location, good price
review.negativeRemarks: rooms smelled a bit musty and stuffy, but our noses quickly adjusted. Clean otherwise.
review.locationRemarks: we walked to restaurants near by.

review.title: Location was wonderful
review.reviewText: Our second time staying here because of location. It's no fancy hotel but totally served its purpose

review.title: Nice hotel near from the pears
review.reviewText: Every thin was ok

The other people where extremely noisy extremely at 3am and no one told them to be quiet until we asked them too. Cleaning ladies where moping on my way out and they continue mopping and wouldn't move out of my way which by the way was in front of my door.

review.title: Much more than I expected
review.reviewText: We stayed with ABVI for 2 nights and to tell you the truth after reading so many negative responses about this place, I was feeling worried, but I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and comfort of our room. We were lucky to get a room away from the street, so the noise wasn't an issue.Parking is very limited, but we were able to find spots both nights.Breakfast area is really tiny, but hey, it's San Francisco-the space is priceless. I didn't expect much for breakfast so I wasn't disappointed, don't waste your time all they have is toast and packets of oatmeal with some cold drinks and coffee/tea. Overall our trip turned out to be great and we didn't see any bedbugs, which was my major concern. Will stay with them again.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: Rethink your breakfast, the selection was just too limited
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Presidio Park

review.title: central location
review.reviewText: even the locals asked us how we found out about staying on lombard st.,right in the middle of everything
review.positiveRemarks: location,get bus passes at walgreens (one st. down on Chestnut st.)go everywhere. Parking,Price
review.negativeRemarks: Parking,first come first serve, but public parking one st. over on pierce st.
review.locationRemarks: shops restaurants and bus stops

review.title: easy area, great peoples, easy bus to town.
review.reviewText: best city in the USA!!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: GREAT
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate, parks, China Town, Little Italy, Fisherman Worf, Marina etc

review.title: Not bad hotel close to Golden Gate
review.reviewText:
The hotel was ok in general. But it's on a road so it's kinda noisy during the night.
It's clean. It has nice kitchen with a stove and a microwave and a full size fridge.

The room is not big but we could fit without the problems.
review.positiveRemarks: Fast internet. Clean. Nice shower. Big kitchen with full size fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate and Pier 39 with Cable Car are about 2 miles away. It was easy to walk there. There is a bus stop right by the hotel as well.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We stayed here two separate times on our trip to San Francisco. Our first experience was great our room was great and the staff that checked us in was amazing. When we checked out we requested that when we checked back in, 2 days later, a top floor room towards the back. We were told yes no problem and that a note would be added to our reservation. This was not done so we did not get the room promised to us. Our first room was great however in our second room the sheets were torn, and the TV did not work properly.
review.locationRemarks: There are great restaurants and shopping in walking distance.

review.title: Inexpensive hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: For the price, the hotel was decent. I was comfortable here and I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Price was good.
review.locationRemarks: Very easy access to Fisherman's wharf and golden gate bridge.

review.title: Average stay
review.reviewText: Run down a little but staff were very helpful to upgrade us free of charge :)

review.title: Hotel experience
review.reviewText:
Good location and convenient to go around. Bus stop is close to hotel. Some reception staff are nice and helpful; there was one failed to provide the wake up call in one morning
. Reasonsable cost snd services for budget travel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Outlook appearance
review.locationRemarks: Central and convenient
